title: How to Cook Giblets and Liver

steps.headline: Dice an onion.
steps.description: Put into a pot with oil and a little bit of salt.

steps.headline: Remove from heat and put a tablespoon of sweet Hungarian paprika into the pot.
steps.description: Stir thoroughly. If you are a lover of hot food, you may prefer to use hot Hungarian paprika instead.

steps.headline: Put prepared giblets into the pot of onion and paprika.
While this is cooking, peel some potatoes and dice into ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) squares.
Place the potatoes into a pot covered in water.
Bring the water in the potatoes to boil.
When almost soft, put prepared liver into pot.
steps.description: Liver does not take too long to cook.

steps.headline: When the potatoes are soft, you can drain the water off the potatoes, and either dish up the potatoes as they are, or make mashed potatoes.
When the giblets and liver are cooked, turn the heat off.
steps.description: Dish up onto a plate or bowl with the potatoes.

steps.headline: Ensure that there is adequate liquid from the giblets/liver in the bowl.
steps.description: This will make the potatoes when mashed with a fork just fantastic.

text: Dice an onion. Put into a pot with oil and a little bit of salt. Cook onion until golden.  Remove from heat and put a tablespoon of sweet Hungarian paprika into the pot. Stir thoroughly. If you are a lover of hot food, you may prefer to use hot Hungarian paprika instead. Put prepared giblets into the pot of onion and paprika. Cover with hot water. Bring to boil, and simmer.  While this is cooking, peel some potatoes and dice into ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) squares.  Place the potatoes into a pot covered in water.  Bring the water in the potatoes to boil.  When almost soft, put prepared liver into pot. Liver does not take too long to cook. When the potatoes are soft, you can drain the water off the potatoes, and either dish up the potatoes as they are, or make mashed potatoes.  When the giblets and liver are cooked, turn the heat off. Dish up onto a plate or bowl with the potatoes. Ensure that there is adequate liquid from the giblets/liver in the bowl. This will make the potatoes when mashed with a fork just fantastic.
